Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	011	1KI	022	043	And he walked in the entire way of Asa, his father, and he did not decline from it. And he did what was right in the sight of the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	004	And Mordecai said, “By God have these things been done.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	005	I remember a dream that I saw, which signified these same things, and nothing of this whatsoever has failed to occur.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	006	The little fountain which grew into a river, and had turned into light and into the sun, and overflowed into many waters, is Esther, whom the king received as wife and whom he preferred to be queen.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	007	But the two dragons are I and Haman.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	008	The peoples who gathered together are those who had attempted to erase the name of the Jews.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	009	And my people is Israel, who cried out to the Lord, and the Lord brought salvation to his people, and he freed us from all evils, and he created great signs and portents among the nations.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	010	And he commanded there to be two lots, one for the people of God and the other for all the nations.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	011	And both lots arrived at the day appointed before God, even from that past time, for all peoples.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	012	And the Lord remembered his people and had mercy on his inheritance.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	010	013	And these days shall be observed in the month of Adar, on the fourteenth and fifteenth day of the same month, with all zealousness and joy, by the people gathered together into one union, throughout all the generations hereafter of the people of Israel.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	001	In the fourth year of the reigns of Ptolemy and Cleopatra, Dositheus, who was himself a priest and born of the Levites, and Ptolemy his son, brought this epistle of Purim, which they said was a translation by Lysimachus the son of Ptolemy in Jerusalem.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	002	In the second year of the reign of Artaxerxes the great, on the first day of the month of Nisan, Mordecai the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, of the tribe of Benjamin,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	003	a Jewish man who lived in the city of Susa, a great gentleman, and among the first ones of the king’s court, saw a dream.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	004	Now he was one of a number of captives, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away from Jerusalem with Jeconiah king of Judah.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	005	And this was his dream: voices appeared, and confusion, and thunders, and earthquakes, and a disturbance upon the earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	006	And behold, there were two great dragons making preparations against one another for battle.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	007	And at their cry all peoples rushed forth to fight against the nation of the just.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	008	And that was a day of darkness and division, of tribulation and anguish, and there was an unnatural dread over the earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	009	And the nation of the just was disturbed, fearing their own evils, and was prepared for death.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	010	And they cried out to God, and from their loud crying, a little fountain grew into a very great river and overflowed into many waters.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	011	The light and the sun rose up, and the humble were exalted, and they devoured the illustrious.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	011	012	When Mordecai had seen this, and he arose from bed, he was considering what God might want to do, and he kept it fixed in his soul, desiring to know what the dream might signify.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	001	Now he was staying at that time in the king’s court with Bagatha and Thara the king’s eunuchs, who were porters of the palace.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	002	And when he realized their thoughts, and had diligently paid close attention, he learned that they were attempting to cast their hand against king Artaxerxes, and he reported this to the king.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	003	Then the king had both of them questioned, and when they confessed, he ordered a sentence of death.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	004	But the king had what had happened written in the commentaries. And even Mordecai handed over the memory of these things into writing.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	005	And the king instructed him to remain in the court of the palace, having given him this position for the information.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	012	006	In truth, Haman the son of Hammedatha the Bougaean had great honor in the eyes of the king, and he wanted to harm Mordecai and his people because of the two eunuchs of the king who had been executed.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	001	And this was the text of the letter:    “Artaxerxes, the great king from India all the way to Ethiopia, to the leaders and generals of the one hundred twenty-seven provinces, which are subject to his authority, greetings.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	002	Although I have reigned over many nations and subjugated the whole world under my realm, I was by no means willing to abuse the greatness of this power, but to govern my subjects with clemency and leniency, so that they would settle into a quiet life, apart from any terror, and delight in peace, as all mortals would choose to do.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	003	Yet, in asking my counselors how this might be able to be accomplished, one who excelled the others in wisdom and fidelity, and who was second after the king, named Haman,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	004	explained to me that there was a people, scattered throughout the whole world, that used strange laws, and, acting against the customs of all peoples, despised the commandments of kings and violated the harmony of all nations with their dissension.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	005	When we had learned this, seeing one nation rebellious against all mankind, having overthrown the usefulness of laws, and going against our orders, and disturbing the peace and harmony of the provinces subject to us,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	006	we commanded that whomever Haman, who is chief over all the provinces, and second after the king, and whom we honor in the place of a father, whomever he would point out should be destroyed by their enemies, with their wives and children, and that no one may take pity on them, on the fourteenth day of the twelfth month Adar of this present year,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	007	so that these guilty men, all on one day, may go down to the underworld, restoring to our empire the peace that they had disturbed.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	008	Now Mordecai beseeched the Lord, remembering all his works,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	009	and he said, “O Lord, Lord, almighty King, truly all things are possible for you, and there is no one who is able to resist your will, if you would determine to save Israel.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	010	You have created heaven and earth, and everything that is contained under the cycle of heaven.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	011	You are Lord of all, and there is no one who can resist your majesty.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	012	You know everything, and you know that it was not out of arrogance or indignation or some desire for glory that I did this, so that I refused to adore the very proud Haman.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	013	(For I was freely prepared, for the sake of the salvation of Israel, to have willingly kissed even the footsteps of his feet.)
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	014	But I feared, lest I should transfer the honor of my God to a man, and lest I should adore anyone except my God.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	015	And now Lord, King, God of Abraham, may you have mercy on your people because our enemies want to destroy us and to erase your inheritance.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	016	Do not despise your portion, which you have redeemed for yourself out of Egypt.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	017	Listen to my supplication, and be gracious to your lot and your token, and change our sorrow into gladness, so that, in living, we may praise your name, Lord; and do not close the mouths of those who sing to you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	013	018	Likewise, all Israel cried out to the Lord with the same intention and supplication because certain death was hanging over them.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	001	Queen Esther also, fearing the danger that was imminent, fled to the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	002	And when she had put aside her royal apparel, she took up garments suitable for weeping and mourning, and instead of various ointments, she covered her head with ashes from burnt dung, and she humbled her body with fasting, and all the aspects of her beauty, she covered with her torn hair.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	003	And she begged the Lord God of Israel, saying, “My Lord, who alone is our King, help me, a solitary woman, for there is no other helper but you.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	004	My peril is close at hand.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	005	I have heard from my father that you, Lord, chose Israel from among all nations and our fathers from among all their former ancestors, to possess them as an everlasting inheritance, and you have done for them just as you said.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	006	We have sinned in your sight, and therefore you have delivered us into the hands of our enemies,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	007	for we have worshipped their gods. You are just, O Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	008	And now they are not content to oppress us with a very difficult servitude, but attributing the strength of their hands to the power of their idols,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	009	they want to alter your promises, and erase your inheritance, and close the mouths of those who praise you, and extinguish the glory of your temple and your altar,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	010	so that they may open the mouths of the nations, and praise the strength of idols, and proclaim a worldly king in perpetuity.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	011	Lord, do not hand over your scepter to that which does not exist, lest they laugh at our ruin, but turn their counsel upon themselves and destroy him who has begun to rage against us.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	012	Be mindful, Lord, and show yourself to us in the time of our tribulation, and give me faith, Lord, King of gods and of every power.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	013	Grant fitting words to my mouth in the sight of the lion, and transform his heart to hate our enemy, so that both he, and the others who conspire with him, may perish.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	014	But free us by your hand, and help me, who has no other helper but you, Lord, who holds the knowledge of all things.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	015	And you know that I hate the glory of the wicked, and I detest the bed of the uncircumcised, and of all outsiders.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	016	You know my necessity, that I loathe the sign of my exaltation and glory, which is on my head in the days of my exhibition, and that I detest it like a menstruous rag and do not wear it in the days of my silence,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	017	and that I have not eaten at Haman’s table, nor has the king’s feasts pleased me, and that I have not drunk the wine of his libations,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	018	and that your handmaid has never rejoiced, from the time that I was carried here until this very day, except in you, Lord, God of Abraham.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	014	019	O God, whose strength is above all things, heed the voice of those who have no other hope,and free us from the hand of the wicked, and rescue me from my fear.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	001	And he entrusted her (there was no question but that it was Mordecai) to go in to the king, and to petition on behalf of her people and her native land.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	002	“Remember,” he said, “the days of your lowliness, how you were nurtured as if in my hand, because Haman, who is second after the king, has spoken against us to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	003	And you must call upon the Lord, and speak with the king on our behalf, and free us from death.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	004	So, on the third day, she put away her ornate apparel, and surrounded herself with glory.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	005	And when she was shining in a royal manner, and had called upon God, the Guide and Savior of all, she took two maids with her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	006	And she was leaning upon one of them, as if, out of delicateness and great tenderness, she were not able to bear carrying her own body.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	007	And the other maid followed her lady, carrying her garment flowing on the ground.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	008	Yet she had a rosy color pouring over her face, for, with gracious and bright eyes, she restrained a sorrowful soul and very great fear.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	009	And so, entering hesitantly through a series of doors, she stood opposite the king, where he sat upon his royal throne, clothed in royal robes, and shining with gold and precious stones. And he was terrible to behold.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	010	And when he had lifted up his face, and with burning eyes had shown the fury of his heart, the queen collapsed, and her color turned pale, and she rested her exhausted head upon her handmaid.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	011	And God changed the king’s spirit into gentleness; quickly and apprehensively, he leapt from his throne, and lifting her up in his arms until she came to herself, he coaxed her with these words:
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	012	“What is the matter, Esther? I am your brother, do not be afraid.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	013	You will not die. For this law has not been established for you, but for all others.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	014	So approach and touch the scepter.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	015	And since she remained silent, he took the golden scepter and placed it on her neck, and he kissed her and said, “Why do you not speak to me?”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	016	She answered, “I saw you, my lord, as an angel of God, and my heart was disturbed for fear of your glory.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	017	For you, my lord, are great and wonderful, and your face is full of grace.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	018	And while she was speaking, she collapsed again, because she was out of breath.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	015	019	But the king was troubled, and all his servants consoled her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	001	“Artaxerxes, the great king from India all the way to Ethiopia, to the generals and leaders of the one hundred twenty-seven provinces that obey our command: greetings, he says.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	002	In arrogance, many have abused the goodness of leaders and the honor that has been bestowed on them,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	003	and they strive, not only to oppress the king’s subjects, but, not acting according to the glory given to them, set in motion a plan to ambush those very ones who gave it.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	004	Neither are they content to withhold thanks for benefits and to violate in themselves the laws of humanity, but they also think they are able to escape from every sentence of the sifting judgment of God.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	005	And they rush forth in such insanity that they attempt to subvert by filthy lies those who carefully fulfill the offices delegated to them and so perform everything that is deserving of the praise of all.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	006	Meanwhile, they craftily deceive by fraud the ears of single-minded leaders, and they judge others according to their own nature.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	007	These things are proven both from the ancient histories and from those things which happen daily: how the zeal of kings can be corrupted by the evil suggestions of such persons.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	008	Therefore, we will make provision for the peace of all the provinces.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	009	Neither should you think, if we change our orders, that they come from a fickle mind, but that we draw conclusions from the quality and necessity of the times, just as the expediency of the public good demands.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	010	And, so that you may more clearly understand what we are saying: Haman the son of Hammedatha, a Macedonian both in mind and ancestry, and foreign to Persian blood, and with his cruelty contaminating our piety, was accepted by us as a sojourner.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	011	And our humanity proved to be so great towards him that he was called our father and was adored by all as second only to the king.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	012	But he was so filled with arrogance as to strive to deprive us of our kingdom and our life.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	013	For example, with certain strange and unheard of machinations, he sought the death of Mordecai, whose faith and kindness kept us alive, and Esther, the partner of our kingdom, and all their people.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	014	This he planned so that, after they were executed, he might work treason against us in our solitude and transfer the kingdom of the Persians to the Macedonians.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	015	But we, having been resolved to ruin in death the mortal Jews, discovered no fault within them, but on the contrary, they use just laws
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	016	and are sons of the highest and greatest and ever-living God, by whose kindness the kingdom was handed down both to our fathers and to us, and is cared for even unto this day.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	017	Therefore, you should understand to be null and void those letters that he administered under our name.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	018	For this crime, before the gates of this city, that is, Susa, both he who devised it, and all his associates, hang on gallows: not we, but God repaying him as he deserved.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	019	But this edict, which we now send, shall be displayed in all cities so that the Jews may be allowed to use their own laws.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	020	You must be a support to them, so that they may be able to execute those, who themselves had prepared to kill them, on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is called Adar.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	021	For the almighty God has turned this day of grief and sorrow into joy for them.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	022	Therefore, you too will keep this day, along with the other festival days, and celebrate it with all joy, so that it may be known even by future generations.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	023	All those who faithfully obey the Persians deserve, for their fidelity, to receive a reward, but those who are traitors to their kingdom deserve to be destroyed for their crime.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	017	EST	016	024	But every province and city, which is not willing to participate in this solemnity, must perish by the sword and by fire, and be destroyed in this way so that they will be forever an indisputable example of contempt and disobedience, not only to humans, but even to wild animals.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	018	JOB	016	004	I, too, can speak like you; and I also wish that your soul favored my soul.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	019	PSA	002	012	Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord might become angry,   and you would perish from the way of the just.

Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	023	ISA	045	023	I have sworn by myself. The Word of justice will proceed from my mouth, and it will not turn back.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	024	And they were walking in the midst of the flame, praising God and blessing the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	025	Then Azariah, while standing, prayed in this manner, and opening his mouth in the midst of the fire, he said:
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	026	“Blessed are you, O Lord, the God of our fathers, and your name is praiseworthy and glorious for all ages.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	027	For you are just in all the things that you have accomplished for us, and all your works are true, and your ways are right, and all your judgments are true.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	028	For you have made equally true judgments in all the things that you have brought upon us and upon Jerusalem, the holy city of our fathers. For in truth and in judgment, you have brought down all these things because of our sins.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	029	For we have sinned, and we have committed iniquity in withdrawing from you, and we have offended in all things.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	030	And we have not listened to your precepts, nor have we observed or done as you have ordered us, so that it might go well with us.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	031	Therefore, everything that you have brought upon us, and all that you have done for us, you have done in true judgment.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	032	And you have delivered us into the hands of our enemies: traitors, unjust and most wicked, and to a king, unjust and most wicked, even more so than all others on earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	033	And now we are not able to open our mouths. We have become a shame and a disgrace to your servants and to those who worship you.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	034	Do not hand us over forever, we ask you, because of your name, and do not abolish your covenant.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	035	And do not withdraw your mercy from us, because of Abraham, your beloved, and Isaac, your servant, and Israel, your holy one.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	036	You have spoken with them, promising that you would multiply their offspring like the stars of heaven and like the sand on the seashore.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	037	For we, O Lord, are diminished more than all other peoples, and we are brought low throughout all the earth, this day, because of our sins.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	038	Neither is there, at this time, a leader, or a ruler, or a prophet, nor any holocaust, or sacrifice, or oblation, or incense, or place of first fruits, in your eyes,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	039	so that we may be able to find your mercy. Nevertheless, with a contrite soul and humble spirit, let us be accepted.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	040	Just as in the holocausts of rams and bullocks, and as in thousands of fat lambs, so let our sacrifice be in your sight this day, in order to please you. For there is no shame for those who trust in you.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	041	And now we follow you wholeheartedly, and we fear you, and we seek your face.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	042	Do not put us to shame, but deal with us in agreement with your clemency and according to the multitude of your mercies.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	043	And rescue us by your wonders and give glory to your name, O Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	044	And let all those be confounded who lead your servants towards evil. May they be confounded by all your power and may their strength be crushed.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	045	And may they know that you are the Lord, the only God, and glorious above the world.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	046	And they did not cease, those attendants of the king who had cast them in, to heat the furnace with oil, and flax, and pitch, and brush.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	047	And the flame streamed forth above the furnace for forty-nine cubits.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	048	And the fire erupted and burnt those of the Chaldeans within its reach near the furnace.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	049	But the angel of the Lord descended with Azariah and his companions into the furnace; and he cast the flame of the fire out of the furnace.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	050	And he made the middle of the furnace like the blowing of a damp wind, and the fire did not touch them, nor afflict them, nor bother them at all.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	051	Then these three, as if with one voice, praised and glorified and blessed God, in the furnace, saying:
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	052	“Blessed are you, Lord, God of our fathers: praiseworthy, and glorious, and exalted above all forever. And blessed is the holy name of your glory: praiseworthy, and exalted above all, for all ages.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	053	Blessed are you in the holy temple of your glory: praiseworthy above all and exalted above all forever.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	054	Blessed are you on the throne of your kingdom: praiseworthy above all and exalted above all forever.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	055	Blessed are you who beholds the abyss and sits upon the cherubim: praiseworthy and exalted above all forever.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	056	Blessed are you in the firmament of heaven: praiseworthy and glorious forever.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	057	All works of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all forever.

For he has delivered us from the underworld, and saved us from the hand of death, and freed us from the midst of the burning flame, and rescued us from the midst of the fire.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	089	Give thanks to the Lord because he is good: because his mercy is forever.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	003	090	All those who are pious, bless the Lord, the God of gods: praise him and acknowledge him because his mercy is for all generations.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	001	And there was a man living in Babylon, and his name was Joakim.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	002	And he received a wife named Susanna, the daughter of Hilkiah, who was very beautiful and God-fearing.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	003	For her parents, because they were righteous, had educated their daughter according to the law of Moses.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	004	But Joakim was very wealthy, and he had an orchard near his house, and the Jews flocked to him, because he was the most honorable of them all.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	005	And two elder judges had been appointed among the people that year, about whom the Lord has said, “Iniquity has come out of Babylon, from the elder judges, who seemed to govern the people.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	006	These frequented the house of Joakim, and all came to them, who had need of judgment.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	007	But when the people departed at noontime, Susanna went in and walked around in her husband’s orchard.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	008	And the elders saw her entering and walking around every day, and they were inflamed with desire towards her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	009	And they perverted their reason and turned away their eyes, so that they would not look to heaven, nor call to mind just judgments.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	010	And so they were both wounded by the love of her, yet they did not reveal their grief to one another.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	011	For they were ashamed to reveal to each other their desire, wanting to lie with her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	012	And so they watched carefully every day to see her. And one said to the other,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	013	“Let us go home, for it is lunch time.” And going out, they departed one from another.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	014	And returning again, they came to the same place, and, each asking the other the reason, they admitted their desire. And then they agreed to set a time when they would be able to find her alone.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	015	But it happened, while they watched for an opportune day, that she entered at a particular time, just as yesterday and the day before, with only two maids, and she wanted to wash in the orchard, because it was so hot.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	016	And there was no one there, except the two elders in hiding, and they were studying her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	017	And so she said to the maids, “Bring me oil and ointments, and shut the doors of the orchard, so that I may wash.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	018	And they did as she ordered them. And they shut the doors of the orchard and left through a back door to fetch what she required, and they did not know that the elders were hiding within.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	019	But when the maids had departed, the two elders arose and hurried to her, and they said,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	020	“Behold, the doors of the orchard are closed, and no one can see us, and we are in desire for you. Because of these things, consent to us and lie with us.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	021	But if you will not, we will bear witness against you that a young man was with you and, for this reason, you sent your maids away from you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	022	Susanna sighed and said, “I am closed in on every side. For if I do this thing, it is death to me; yet if I do not do it, I will not escape your hands.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	023	But it is better for me to fall unavoidably into your hands, than to sin in the sight of the Lord.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	024	And Susanna cried out with a loud voice, but the elders also cried out against her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	025	And one of them hurried to the door of the orchard and opened it.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	026	And so, when the servants of the house heard the outcry in the orchard, they rushed in by the back door to see what was happening.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	027	But after the old men had spoken, the servants were greatly ashamed, for there had never been anything of this kind said about Susanna.    And it happened on the next day,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	028	when the people came to Joakim her husband, that the two appointed elders also came, full of wicked plans against Susanna, in order to put her to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	029	And they said before the people, “Send for Susanna, daughter of Hilkiah, the wife of Joakim.” And immediately they sent for her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	030	And she arrived with her parents, and sons, and all her relatives.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	031	Moreover, Susanna was exceedingly delicate and beautiful in appearance.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	032	But those wicked ones commanded that her face should be uncovered, (for she was covered,) so that at least they might be satisfied with her beauty.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	033	Therefore, her own and all who knew her wept.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	034	Yet the two appointed elders, rising up in the midst of the people, set their hands upon her head.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	035	And weeping, she gazed up to heaven, for her heart had faith in the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	036	And the appointed elders said, “While we were taking a walk in the orchard alone, this one came in with two maids, and she shut the doors of the orchard, and she sent the maids away from her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	037	And a young man came to her, who was in hiding, and he lay down with her.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	038	Furthermore, since we were in a corner of the orchard, seeing this wickedness, we ran up to them, and we saw them consorting together.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	039	And, indeed, we were unable to catch him, because he was stronger than us, and opening the doors, he leaped out.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	040	But, since we had apprehended this one, we demanded to know who the young man was, but she was unwilling to tell us. On this matter, we are witnesses.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	041	The multitude believed them, just as if they were elders and the judges of the people, and they condemned her to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	042	But Susanna cried out with a loud voice and said, “Eternal God, who knows what is hidden, who knows all things before they happen,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	043	you know that they have borne false witness against me, and behold, I must die, though I have done none of these things, which these men have maliciously invented against me.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	044	But the Lord heeded her voice.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	045	And when she was led away to death, the Lord raised up the holy spirit of a young boy, whose name was Daniel.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	046	And he cried out with a loud voice, “I am clean of the blood of this one.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	047	And all the people, turning back towards him, said, “What is this word that you are saying?”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	048	But he, while standing in the midst of them, said, “Are you so foolish, sons of Israel, that without judging and without knowing what the truth is, you have condemned a daughter of Israel?
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	049	Return to judgment, because they have spoken false witness against her.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	050	Therefore, the people returned with haste, and the old men said to him, “Come and sit down in our midst and show us, since God has given you the honor of old age.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	051	And Daniel said to them, “Separate these at a distance from one another, and I will judge between them.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	052	And so, when they were divided, one from the other, he called one of them, and he said to him, “You deep-rooted ancient evil, now your sins have come out, which you have committed before,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	053	judging unjust judgments, oppressing the innocent, and setting free the guilty, though the Lord declares, ‘The innocent and the just you must not put to death.’
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	054	Now then, if you saw her, declare under which tree you saw them conversing together.” He said, “Under an evergreen mastic tree.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	055	But Daniel said, “Truly, you have lied against your own head. For behold, the angel of God, having received the sentence from him, will split you down the middle.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	056	And, having put him aside, he commanded the other to approach, and he said to him, “You offspring of Canaan, and not of Judah, beauty has deceived you, and desire has perverted your heart.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	057	Thus did you do to the daughters of Israel, and they, out of fear, consorted with you, but a daughter of Judah would not tolerate your iniquity.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	058	Now then, declare to me, under which tree you caught them conversing together.” He said, “Under an evergreen oak tree.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	059	And Daniel said to him, “Truly, you also have lied against your own head. For the angel of the Lord waits, holding a sword, to cut you down the middle and put you to death.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	060	And then the entire assembly cried out in a loud voice, and they blessed God, who saves those who hope in him.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	061	And they rose up against the two appointed elders, (for Daniel had convicted them, by their own mouth, of bearing false witness,) and they did to them just as they had wickedly done against their neighbor,
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	062	so as to act according to the law of Moses. And they put them to death, and innocent blood was saved on that day.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	063	But Hilkiah and his wife praised God for their daughter, Susanna, with Joakim, her husband, and all her relatives, because there had been found in her no disgrace.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	064	And so Daniel became great in the sight of the people from that day, and thereafter.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	013	065	And king Astyages was laid to rest with his fathers. And Cyrus the Persian received his kingdom.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	001	And so Daniel was living with the king, and he was honored above all his friends.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	002	Now there was an idol with the Babylonians named Bel. And each day there was expended on him twelve great measures of fine flour, and forty sheep, and six vessels of wine.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	003	The king likewise worshipped him and went each day to adore him, but Daniel adored his God. And the king said to him, “Why do you not adore Bel?”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	004	And answering, he said to him, “Because I do not worship idols made with hands, but the living God, who created heaven and earth, and who holds power over all flesh.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	005	And the king said to him, “Does not Bel seem to you to be a living god? Do you not see how much he eats and drinks every day?”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	006	Then Daniel said, smiling, “O king, do not make a mistake, for this one is clay on the inside and brass on the outside, and he has never eaten.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	007	And the king, being angry, called for his priests and said to them, “If you do not tell me who it is that has eaten these expenses, you will die.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	008	But if you can show that Bel has eaten these, Daniel will die, because he has blasphemed against Bel.” And Daniel said to the king, “Let it be according to your word.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	009	Now the priests of Bel were seventy, besides their wives, and little ones, and sons. And the king went with Daniel into the temple of Bel.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	010	And the priests of Bel said, “Behold, we are going out, and you, O king, set out the meats, and mix the wine, and close the door, and seal it with your ring.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	011	And when you have entered in the morning, if you have not found that Bel has consumed all, we will suffer death, or else Daniel will, who has lied against us.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	012	But they had no concern because they had made a secret entrance under the table, and they always went in through it and devoured those things.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	013	And so it happened, after they had departed, that the king set the foods before Bel, and Daniel commanded his servants, and they brought ashes, and he sifted them throughout the temple in the sight of the king, and, as they left, they shut the door, and after sealing it with the king’s ring, they departed.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	014	But the priests entered by night, according to their custom, with their wives, and their sons, and they ate and drank everything.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	015	But the king arose at first light, and Daniel with him.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	016	And the king said, “Are the seals unbroken, Daniel?” And he answered, “They are unbroken, O king.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	017	And as soon as he had opened the door, the king stared at the table, and cried out with a loud voice, “Great are you, O Bel, and there is not any deceit with you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	018	And Daniel laughed, and he held back the king, so that he would not enter, and he said, “Look at the pavement, notice whose footsteps these are.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	019	And the king said, “I see the footsteps of men, and women, and children.” And the king was angry.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	020	Then he apprehended the priests, and their wives, and their sons, and they showed him the secret doors through which they entered and consumed the things that were on the table.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	021	Therefore, the king slaughtered them and delivered Bel into the power of Daniel, who overturned him and his temple.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	022	And there was a great dragon in that place, and the Babylonians worshipped him.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	023	And the king said to Daniel, “Behold, now you cannot say that this is not a living god; therefore, adore him.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	024	And Daniel said, “I adore the Lord, my God, for he is the living God. But that one is not a living god.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	025	Therefore, you give me the power, O king, and I will execute this dragon without sword or club.” And the king said, “I give it to you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	026	And so Daniel took pitch, and fat, and hair, and cooked them together. And he made lumps and put them into the dragon’s mouth, and the dragon burst open. And he said, “Behold, this is what you worship.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	027	When the Babylonians had heard this, they were greatly indignant. And gathering together against the king, they said, “The king has become a Jew. He has destroyed Bel, he has executed the dragon, and he has slaughtered the priests.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	028	And when they came to the king, they said, “Deliver Daniel to us, otherwise we will execute you and your house.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	029	Thus the king saw that they pressured him vehemently, and so, being compelled by necessity, he delivered Daniel to them.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	030	And they cast him into the den of lions, and he was there for six days.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	031	Furthermore, in the den there were seven lions, and they had given to them two carcasses every day, and two sheep, but then they were not given to them, so that they would devour Daniel.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	032	Now there was in Judea a prophet called Habakkuk, and he had cooked a small meal and had broken bread in a bowl, and he was going into the field, to bring it to the harvesters.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	033	And the angel of the Lord said to Habakkuk, “Carry the meal that you have into Babylon, to Daniel, who is in the lions’ den.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	034	And Habakkuk said, “Lord, I have not seen Babylon, and I do not know the den.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	035	And the angel of the Lord seized him by the top of his head, and carried him by the hair of his head, and set him in Babylon, over the den, by the force of his spirit.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	036	And Habakkuk shouted, saying, “Daniel, servant of God, take the dinner that God has sent you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	037	And Daniel said, “You have remembered me, O God, and you have not abandoned those who love you.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	038	And Daniel arose and ate. And then the angel of the Lord immediately returned Habakkuk to his place.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	039	And so, on the seventh day, the king came to mourn Daniel. And he came to the den, and gazed in, and behold, Daniel was sitting in the midst of the lions.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	040	And the king cried out with a loud voice, saying, “Great are you, O Lord, the God of Daniel.” And he pulled him out of the lions’ den.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	041	Furthermore, those who had been the cause of his downfall, he hurled into the den, and they were devoured in a moment before him.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	027	DAN	014	042	Then the king said, “Let all the inhabitants of the whole earth fear the God of Daniel. For he is the Savior, working signs and miracles on earth, who has freed Daniel from the lions’ den.”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	028	HOS	002	023	And I will plant her for me in the land, and I will have mercy on her, though she had been called Without Mercy.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	030	AMO	006	010	And his closest relative will steal him away and will burn him, so that he may carry the bones out of the house. And he will say to him that is in the inner most rooms of the house, “Now is there any left that still belongs to you?”
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	043	JOH	006	051	I am the living bread, who descended from heaven.
Holy-Bible---English---Catholic-Public-Domain	066	REV	012	018	And he stood upon the sand of the sea.

Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	007	JDG	005	031	So let all thy enemies perish, O Lord: but let them that love thee shine, as the sun shineth in his rising.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	009	1SA	020	042	And Jonathan said to David: Go in peace: and let all stand that we have sworn both of us in the name of the Lord, saying: The Lord be between me and thee, and between my seed and thy seed for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	011	1KI	022	043	And he walked in all the way of Asa his father, and he declined not from it: and he did that which was right in the sight of the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	004	Then Mardochai said: God hath done these things.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	005	I remember a dream that I saw, which signified these same things: and nothing thereof hath failed.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	006	The little fountain which grew into a river, and was turned into a light, and into the sun, and abounded into many waters, is Esther, whom the king married, and made queen.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	007	But the two dragons are I and Aman.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	008	The nations that were assembled are they that endeavoured to destroy the name of the Jews.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	009	And my nation is Israel, who cried to the Lord, and the Lord saved his people: and he delivered us from all evils, and hath wrought great signs and wonders among the nations:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	010	And he commanded that there should be two lots, one of the people of God, and the other of all the nations.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	011	And both lots came to the day appointed already from that time before God to all nations:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	012	And the Lord remembered his people, and had mercy on his inheritance.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	010	013	And these days shall be observed in the month of Adar on the fourteenth, and fifteenth day of the same month. with all diligence, and joy of the people gathered into one assembly, throughout all the generations hereafter of the people of Israel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	001	In the fourth year of the reign of Ptolemy and Cleopatra, Dositheus, who said he was a priest, and of the Levitical race, and Ptolemy his son brought this epistle of Phurim, which they said Lysimachus the son of Ptolemy had interpreted in Jerusalem.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	002	In the second year of the reign of Artaxerxes the great, in the first day of the month Nisan, Mardochai the son of Jair, the son of Semei, the son of Cis, of the tribe of Benjamin:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	003	A Jew who dwelt in the city of Susan, a great man and among the first of the king’s court, had it dream.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	004	Now he was of the number of the captives, whom Nabuchodonosor king of Babylon had carried away from Jerusalem with Jechonias king of Juda:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	005	And this was his dream: Behold there were voices, and tumults, and thunders, and earthquakes, and a disturbance upon the earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	006	And behold two great dragons came forth ready to fight one against another.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	007	And at their cry all nations were stirred up to fight against the nation of the just.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	008	And that was a day of darkness and danger, of tribulation and distress, and great fear upon the earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	009	And the nation of the just was troubled fearing their own evils, and was prepared for death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	010	And they cried to God: and as they were crying, a little fountain grew into a very great river, and abounded into many waters.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	011	The light and the sun rose up, and the humble were exalted, and they devoured the glorious.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	011	012	And when Mardochai had seen this, and arose out of his bed, he was thinking what God would do: and he kept it fixed in his mind, desirous to know what the dream should signify.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	001	And he abode at that time in the king’s court with Bagatha and Thara the king’s eunuchs, who were porters of the palace.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	002	And when he understood their designs, and had diligently searched into their projects, he learned that they went about to lay violent hands on king Artaxerxes, and he told the king thereof.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	003	Then the king had them both examined, and after they had confessed, commanded them to be put to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	004	But the king made a record of what was done: and Mardochai also committed the memory of the thing to writing.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	005	And the king commanded him, to abide in the court of the palace, and gave him presents for the information.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	012	006	But Aman the son of Amadathi the Bugite was in great honour with the king, and sought to hurt Mardochai and his people, because of the two eunuchs of the king who were put to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	001	And this was the copy of the letter: Artaxerxes the great king who reigneth from India to Ethiopia, to the princes and governors of the hundred and twenty-seven provinces, that are subject to his empire, greeting.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	002	Whereas I reigned over many nations, and had brought all the world under my dominion, I was not willing to abuse the greatness of my power, but to govern my subjects with clemency and lenity, that they might live quietly without any terror. and might enjoy peace, which is desired by all men.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	003	But when I asked my counsellors how this might be accomplished, one that excelled the rest in wisdom and fidelity, and was second after the king, Aman by name,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	004	Told me that there was a people scattered through the whole world, which used new laws, and acted against the customs of all nations, despised the commandments of kings, and violated by their opposition the concord of all nations.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	005	Wherefore having learned this, and seeing one nation in opposition to all mankind using perverse laws, and going against our commandments, and disturbing the peace and concord of the provinces subject to us,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	006	We have commanded that all whom Aman shall mark out, who is chief over all the provinces, and second after the king, and whom we honour as a father, shall be utterly destroyed by their enemies, with their wives and children, and that none shall have pity on them. on the fourteenth day of the twelfth month Adar of this present year:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	007	That these wicked men going down to hell in one day, may restore to our empire the peace which they had disturbed.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	008	But Mardochai besought the Lord, remembering all his works,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	009	And said: O Lord, Lord, almighty king, for all things are in thy power, and there is none that can resist thy will, if thou determine to save Israel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	010	Thou hast made heaven and earth, and all things that are under the cope of heaven.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	011	Thou art Lord of all, and there is none that can resist thy majesty.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	012	Thou knowest all things, and thou knowest that it was not out of pride and contempt, or any desire of glory, that I refused to worship the proud Aman,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	013	(For I would willingly and readily for the salvation of Israel have kissed even the steps of his feet,)
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	014	But I feared lest I should transfer the honour of my God to a man, and lest I should adore any one except my God.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	015	And now, O Lord, O king, O God of Abraham, have mercy on thy people, because our enemies resolve to destroy us, and extinguish thy inheritance.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	016	Despise not thy portion, which thou hast redeemed for thyself out of Egypt.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	017	Hear my supplication, and be merciful to thy lot and inheritance, and turn our mourning into joy, that we may live and praise thy name, O Lord, and shut not the mouths of them that sing to thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	013	018	And all Israel with like mind and supplication cried to the Lord, because they saw certain death hanging over their heads.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	001	Queen Esther also, fearing the danger that was at hand, had recourse to the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	002	And when she had laid away her royal apparel, she put on garments suitable for weeping and mourning: instead of divers precious ointments, she covered her head with ashes and dung, and she humbled her body with fasts: and all the places in which before she was accustomed to rejoice, she filled with her torn hair.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	003	And she prayed to the Lord the God of Israel, saying: O my Lord, who alone art our king, help me a desolate woman, and who have no other helper but thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	004	My danger is in my hands.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	005	I have heard of my father that thou, O Lord, didst take Israel from among all nations, and our fathers from all their predecessors, to possess them as an everlasting inheritance, and thou hast done to them as thou hast promised.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	006	We have sinned in thy sight, and therefore thou hast delivered us into the hands of our enemies:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	007	For we have worshipped their gods. Thou art just, O Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	008	And now they are not content to oppress us with most hard bondage, but attributing the strength of their hands to the power of their idols,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	009	They design to change thy promises, and destroy thy inheritance, and shut the mouths of them that praise thee, and extinguish the glory of thy temple and altar,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	010	That they may open the mouths of Gentiles, and praise the strength of idols, and magnify for ever a carnal king.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	011	Give not, O Lord, thy sceptre to them that are not, lest they laugh at our ruin: but turn their counsel upon themselves, and destroy him that hath begun to rage against us.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	012	Remember, O Lord, and shew thyself to us in the time of our tribulation, and give me boldness, O Lord, king of gods, and of all power:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	013	Give me a well ordered speech in my mouth in the presence of the lion, and turn his heart to the hatred of our enemy, that both he himself may perish, and the rest that consent to him.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	014	But deliver us by thy hand, and help me, who have no other helper, but thee, O Lord, who hast the knowledge of all things.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	015	And thou knowest that I hate the glory of the wicked, and abhor the bed of the uncircumcised, and of every stranger.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	016	Thou knowest my necessity, that I abominate the sign of my pride and glory, which is upon my head in the days of my public appearance, and detest it as a menstruous rag, and wear it not in the days of my silence,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	017	And that I have not eaten at Aman’s table, nor hath the king’s banquet pleased me, and that I have not drunk the wine of the drink offerings:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	018	And that thy handmaid hath never rejoiced, since I was brought hither unto this day, but in thee, O Lord, the God of Abraham.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	014	019	O God, who art mighty above all, hear the voice of them, that have no other hope, and deliver us from the hand of the wicked, and deliver me from my fear.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	001	And he commanded her (no doubt but he was Mardochai) to go to the king, and petition for her people, and for her country.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	002	Remember, (said he,) the days of thy low estate, how thou wast brought up by my hand, because Aman the second after the king hath spoken against us unto death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	003	And do thou call upon the Lord, and speak to the king for us, and deliver us from death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	004	And on the third day she laid away the garments she wore, and put on her glorious apparel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	005	And glittering in royal robes, after she had called upon God the ruler and Saviour of all, she took two maids with her,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	006	And upon one of them she leaned, as if for delicateness and overmuch tenderness she were not able to bear up her own body.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	007	And the other maid followed her lady, bearing up her train flowing on the ground.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	008	But she with a rosy colour in her face, and with gracious and bright eyes, hid a mind full of anguish, and exceeding great fear.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	009	So going in she passed through all the doors in order, and stood before the king, where he sat upon his royal throne, clothed with his royal robes, and glittering with gold, and precious stones, and he was terrible to behold.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	010	And when he had lifted up his countenance, and with burning eyes had shewn the wrath of his heart, the queen sunk down, and her colour turned pale, and she rested her weary head upon her handmaid.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	011	And God changed the king’s spirit into mildness, and all in haste and in fear he leaped from his throne, and holding her up in his arms, till she came to herself, caressed her with these words:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	012	What is the matter, Esther? I am thy brother, fear not.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	013	Thou shalt not die: for this law is not made for thee, but for all others.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	014	Come near then, and touch the sceptre.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	015	And as she held her peace, he took the golden sceptre, and laid it upon her neck, and kissed her, and said: Why dost thou not speak to me?
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	016	She answered: I saw thee, my lord, as an angel of God, and my heart was troubled for fear of thy majesty.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	017	For thou, my lord, art very admirable, and thy. face is full of graces.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	018	And while she was speaking, she fell down again, and was almost in a swoon.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	015	019	But the king was troubled, and all his servants comforted her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	001	The great king Artaxerxes, from India to Ethiopia, to the governors and princes of a hundred and twenty-seven provinces, which obey our command, sendeth greeting.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	002	Many have abused unto pride the goodness of princes, and the honour that hath been bestowed upon them:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	003	And not only endeavour to oppress the king’s subjects, but not bearing the glory that is given them, take in hand to practise also against them that gave it.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	004	Neither are they content not to return thanks for benefits received, and to violate in themselves the laws of humanity, but they think they can also escape the justice of God who seeth all things.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	005	And they break out into so great madness, as to endeavour to undermine by lies such as observe diligently the offices committed to them, and do all things in such manner as to be worthy of all men’s praise,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	006	While with crafty fraud they deceive the ears of princes that are well meaning, and judge of others by their own nature.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	007	Now this is proved both from ancient histories, and by the things which are done daily, how the good designs of kings are depraved by the evil suggestions of certain men.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	008	Wherefore we must provide for the peace of all provinces.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	009	Neither must you think, if we command different things, that it cometh of the levity of our mind, but that we give sentence according to the quality and necessity of times, as the profit of the commonwealth requireth.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	010	Now that you may more plainly understand what we say, I Aman the son of Amadathi, a Macedonian both in mind and country, and having nothing of the Persian blood, but with his cruelty staining our goodness, was received being a stranger by us:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	011	And found our humanity so great towards him, that he was called our father, and was worshipped by all as the next man after the king:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	012	But he was so far puffed up with arrogancy, as to go about to deprive us of our kingdom and life.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	013	For with certain new and unheard of devices he hath sought the destruction of Mardochai, by whose fidelity and good services our life was saved, and of Esther the partner of our kingdom, with all their nation:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	014	Thinking that after they were slain, he might work treason against us left alone without friends, and might transfer the kingdom of the Persians to the Macedonians.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	015	But we have found that the Jews, who were by that most wicked man appointed to be slain, are in no fault at all, but contrariwise, use just laws,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	016	And are the children of the highest and the greatest, and the ever living God, by whose benefit the kingdom was given both to our fathers and to us, and is kept unto this day.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	017	Wherefore know ye that those letters which he sent in our name, are void and of no effect.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	018	For which crime both he himself that devised it, and all his kindred hang on gibbets, before the gates of this city Susan: not we, but God repaying him as he deserved.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	019	But this edict, which we now send, shall be published in all cities, that the Jews may freely follow their own laws.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	020	And you shall aid them that they may kill those who had prepared themselves to kill them, on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is called Adar.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	021	For the almighty God hath turned this day of sadness and mourning into joy to them.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	022	Wherefore you shall also count this day among other festival days, and celebrate it with all joy, that it may be known also in times to come,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	023	That all they who faithfully obey the Persians, receive a worthy reward for their fidelity: but they that are traitors to their kingdom, are destroyed for their wickedness.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	017	EST	016	024	And let every province and city, that will not be partaker of this solemnity, perish by the sword and by fire, and be destroyed in such manner as to be made unpassable, both to men and beasts, for an example of contempt, and disobedience.
