Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	023	ISA	045	023	I have sworn by myself, the word of justice shall go out of my mouth, and shall not return:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	024	And they walked in the midst of the flame, praising God and blessing the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	025	Then Azarias standing up prayed in this manner, and opening his mouth in the midst of the fire, he said:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	026	Blessed art thou, O Lord, the God of our fathers, and thy name is worthy of praise, and glorious for ever:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	027	For thou art just in all that thou hast done to us, and all thy works are true, and thy ways right, and all thy judgments true.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	028	For thou hast executed true judgments in all the things that thou hast brought upon us, and upon Jerusalem the holy city of our fathers: for according to truth and judgment, thou hast brought all these things upon us for our sins.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	029	For we have sinned, and committed iniquity, departing from thee: and we have trespassed in all things:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	030	And we have not hearkened to thy commandments, nor have we observed nor done as thou hadst commanded us, that it might go well with us.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	031	Wherefore all that thou hast brought upon us, and every thing that thou hast done to us, thou hast done in true judgment:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	032	And thou hast delivered us into the hands of our enemies that are unjust, and most wicked, and prevaricators, and to a king unjust, and most wicked beyond all that axe upon the earth.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	033	And now we cannot open our mouths: we are become a shame and reproach to thy servants, and to them that worship thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	034	Deliver us not up for ever, we beseech thee, for thy name’s sake, and abolish not thy covenant.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	035	And take not away thy mercy from us for the sake of Abraham thy beloved, and Isaac thy servant, and Israel thy holy one:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	036	To whom thou hast spoken, promising that thou wouldst multiply their seed as the stars of heaven, and as the sand that is on the sea shore.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	037	For we, O Lord, are diminished more than any nation, and are brought low in all the earth this day for our sins.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	038	Neither is there at this time prince, or leader, or prophet, or holocaust, or sacrifice, or oblation, or incense, or place of firstfruits before thee,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	039	That we may find thy mercy: nevertheless in a contrite heart and humble spirit let us be accepted.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	040	As in holocausts of rams, and bullocks, and as in thousands of fat lambs: so let our sacrifice be made in thy sight this day, that it may please thee: for there is no confusion to them that trust in thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	041	And now we follow thee with all our heart, and we fear thee, and seek thy face.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	042	Put us not to confusion, but deal. with us according to thy meekness, and according to the multitude of thy mercies.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	043	And deliver us according to thy wonderful works, and give glory to thy name, O Lord:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	044	And let all them be confounded that shew evils to thy servants, let them be confounded in all thy might, and let their strength be broken.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	045	And let them know that thou art the Lord, the only God, and glorious over all the world.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	046	Now the king’s servants that had cast them in, ceased not to heat the furnace with brimstone, and tow, and pitch, and dry sticks,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	047	And the flame mounted up above the furnace nine and forty cubits:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	048	And it broke forth, and burnt such of the Chaldeans as it found near the furnace.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	049	But the angel of the Lord went down with Azarias and his companions into the furnace: and he drove the flame of the fire out of the furnace,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	050	And made the midst of the furnace like the blowing of a wind bringing dew, and the fire touched them not at all, nor troubled them, nor did them any harm.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	051	Then these three as with one mouth praised, and glorified, and blessed God in the furnace, saying:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	052	Blessed art thou, O Lord the God of our fathers: and worthy to be praised, and glorified, and exalted above all for ever: and blessed is the holy name of thy glory: and worthy to be praised, and exalted above all in all ages.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	053	Blessed art thou in the holy temple of thy glory: and exceedingly to be praised, and exceeding glorious for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	054	Blessed art thou on the throne of thy kingdom, and exceedingly to be praised, and exalted above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	055	Blessed art thou, that beholdest the depths, and sittest upon the cherubims: and worthy to be praised and exalted above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	056	Blessed art thou in the firmament of heaven: and worthy of praise, and glorious for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	057	All ye works of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	058	O ye angels of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	059	O ye heavens, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	060	O all ye waters that are above the heavens, bless the Lord; praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	061	O all ye powers of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	062	O ye sun and moon, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	063	O ye stars of heaven, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	064	O every shower and dew, bless ye the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	065	O all ye spirits of God, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	066	O ye fire and heat, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	067	O ye cold and heat, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	068	O ye dews and hoar frosts, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	069	O ye frost and cold, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	070	O ye ice and snow, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	071	O ye nights and days, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	072	O ye light and darkness, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	073	O ye lightnings and clouds, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	074	O let the earth bless the Lord: let it praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	075	O ye mountains and hills, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	076	O all ye things that spring up in the earth, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	077	O ye fountains, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	078	O ye seas and rivers, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	079	O ye whales, and all that move in the waters, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	080	O all ye fowls of the air, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	081	O all ye beasts and cattle, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	082	O ye sons of men, bless the Lord, praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	083	O let Israel bless the Lord: let them praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	084	O ye priests of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	085	O ye servants of the Lord, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	086	O ye spirits and souls of the just, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	087	O ye holy and humble of heart, bless the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	088	O Ananias, Azarias, and Misael, bless ye the Lord: praise and exalt him above all for ever. For he hath delivered us from hell, and saved us out of the hand of death, and delivered us out of the midst of the burning flame, and saved us out of the midst of the fire.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	089	O give thanks to the Lord, because he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever and ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	003	090	O all ye religious, bless the Lord the God of gods: praise him and give him thanks, because his mercy endureth for ever and ever.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	001	Now there was a man that dwelt in Babylon, and his name was Joakim:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	002	And he took a wife whose name was Susanna, the daughter of Helcias, a very beautiful woman, and one that feared God.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	003	For her parents being just, had instructed their daughter according to the law of Moses.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	004	Now Joakim was very rich, and had an orchard near his house: and the Jews resorted to him, because he was the most honourable of them all.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	005	And there were two of the ancients of the people appointed judges that year, of whom the Lord said: Iniquity came out from Babylon from the ancient judges, that seemed to govern the people.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	006	These men frequented the house of Joakim, and all that had any matters of judgment came to them.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	007	And when the people departed away at noon, Susanna went in, and walked in her husband’s orchard.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	008	And the old men saw her going in every day, and walking: and they were inflamed with lust towards her:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	009	And they perverted their own mind and turned away their eyes that they might not look unto heaven, nor remember just judgments.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	010	So they were both wounded with the love of her, yet they did not make known their grief one to the other:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	011	For they were ashamed to declare to one another their lust, being desirous to have to do with her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	012	And they watched carefully every day to see her. And one said to the other:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	013	Let us now go home, for it is dinner time. So going out they departed one from another.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	014	And turning back again, they came both to the same place: and asking one another the cause, they acknowledged their lust; and then they agreed upon a time, when they might find her alone.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	015	And it fell out, as they watched a fit day, she went in on a time, as yesterday and the day before, with two maids only, and was desirous to wash herself in the orchard: for it was hot weather.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	016	And there was nobody there, but the two old men that had hid themselves and were beholding her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	017	So she said to the maids: Bring me oil, and washing balls, and shut the doors of the orchard, that I may wash me.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	018	And they did as she bade them: and they shut the doors of the orchard, and went out by a back door to fetch what she had commanded them, and they knew not that the elders were hid within.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	019	Now when the maids were gone forth, the two elders arose, and ran to her, and said:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	020	Behold the doors of the orchard are shut, and nobody seeth us, and we are in love with thee: wherefore consent to us, and lie with us.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	021	But if thou wilt not, we will bear witness against thee, that a young man was with thee, and therefore thou didst send away thy maids from thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	022	Susanna sighed, and said: I am straitened on every side: for if I do this thing, it is death to me: and if I do it not, I shall not escape your hands.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	023	But it is better for me to fall into your hands without doing it, than to sin in the sight of the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	024	With that Susanna cried out with a loud voice: and the elders also cried out against her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	025	And one of them ran to the door of the orchard, and opened it.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	026	So when the servants of the house heard the cry in the orchard, they rushed in by the back door to see what was the matter.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	027	But after the old men had spoken, the servants were greatly ashamed: for never had there been any such word said of Susanna. And on the next day,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	028	When the people were come to Joakim her husband, the two elders also came full of wicked device against Susanna, to put her to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	029	And they said before the people: Send to Susanna daughter of Helcias the wife of Joakim. And presently they sent.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	030	And she came with her parents, and children, and all her kindred.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	031	Now Susanna was exceeding delicate, and beautiful to behold.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	032	But those wicked men commanded that her face should be uncovered, (for she was covered,) that so at least they might be satisfied with her beauty.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	033	Therefore her friends and all her acquaintance wept.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	034	But the two elders rising up in the midst of the people, laid their hands upon her head.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	035	And she weeping looked up to heaven, for her heart had confidence in the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	036	And the elders said: As we walked in the orchard alone, this woman came in with two maids, and shut the doors of the orchard, and sent away the maids from her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	037	Then a young man that was there hid came to her, and lay with her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	038	But we that were in a corner of the orchard, seeing this wickedness, ran up to them, and we saw them lie together.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	039	And him indeed we could not take, because he was stronger than us, and opening the doors be leaped out:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	040	But having taken this woman, we asked who the young man was, but she would not tell us: of this thing we are witnesses.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	041	The multitude believed them as being the elders and the judges of the people, and they condemned her to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	042	Then Susanna cried out with a loud voice, and said: O eternal God, who knowest hidden things, who knowest all things before they come to pass,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	043	Thou knowest that they have borne false witness against me: and behold I must die, whereas I have done none of these things, which these men have maliciously forged against me.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	044	And the Lord heard her voice.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	045	And when she was led to be put to death, the Lord raised up the holy spirit of a young boy, whose name was Daniel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	046	And he cried out with a loud voice I am clear from the blood of this woman.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	047	Then all the people turning themselves towards him, said: What meaneth this word that thou hast spoken?
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	048	But he standing in the midst of them, said: Are ye so foolish, ye children of Israel, that without examination or knowledge of the truth, you have condemned a daughter of Israel?
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	049	Return to judgment, for they have borne false witness against her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	050	So all the people turned again in haste, and the old men said to him: Come, and sit thou down among us, and shew it as: seeing God hath given thee the honour of old age.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	051	And Daniel said to the people: Separate these two far from one another, and I will examine them.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	052	So when they were put asunder one from the other, he called one of them, and said to him: O thou that art grown old in evil days, now are thy sins come out, which thou hast committed before:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	053	In judging unjust judgments, oppressing the innocent, and letting the guilty to go free, whereas the Lord saith: I The innocent and the just thou shalt not kill.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	054	Now then, if thou sawest her, tell me under what tree thou sawest them conversing together. He said: Under a mastic tree.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	055	And Daniel said: Well hast thou lied against thy own head: for behold the angel of God having received the sentence of him, shall cut thee in two.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	056	And having put him aside, he commanded that the other should come, and he said to him: O thou seed of Chanaan, and not of Juda, beauty hath deceived thee, and lust hath perverted thy heart:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	057	Thus did you do to the daughters of Israel, and they for fear conversed with you: but a daughter of Juda would not abide your wickedness.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	058	Now therefore tell me, under what tree didst thou take them conversing together. And he answered: Under a holm tree.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	059	And Daniel said to him: Well hast thou also lied against thy own head: for the angel of the Lord waiteth with a sword to cut thee in two, and to destroy you.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	060	With that all the assembly cried out with a loud voice, and they blessed God, who saveth them that trust in him.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	061	And they rose up against the two elders, (for Daniel had convicted them of false witness by their own mouth,) and they did to them as they had maliciously dealt against their neighbour,
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	062	To fulfill the law of Moses: and they put them to death, and innocent blood was saved in that day.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	063	But Helcias and his wife praised God, for their daughter Susanna, with Joakim her husband, and all her kindred, because there was no dishonesty found in her.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	064	And Daniel became great in the sight of the people from that day, and thenceforward.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	013	065	And king Astyages was gathered to his fathers, and Cyrus the Persian received his kingdom.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	001	And Daniel was the king’s guest, and was honoured above all his friends.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	002	Now the Babylonians had an idol called Bel: and there were spent upon him every day twelve great measures of fine flour, and forty sheep, and sixty vessels of wine.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	003	The king also worshipped him, and went every day to adore him: but Daniel adored his God. And the king said to him: Why dost thou not adore Bel?
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	004	And he answered, and said to him: Because I do not worship idols made with hands, but the living God, that created heaven and earth, and hath power over all flesh.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	005	And the king said to him: Doth not Bel seem to thee to be a living god? Seest thou not how much he eateth and drinketh every day?
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	006	Then Daniel smiled and said: O king, be not deceived: for this is but clay within, and brass without, neither hath he eaten at any time.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	007	And the king being angry called for his priests, and said to them: If you tell me not, who it is that eateth up these expenses, you shall die.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	008	But if you can shew that Bel eateth these things, Daniel shall die, because he hath blasphemed against Bel. And Daniel said to the king: Be it done according to thy word.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	009	Now the priests of Bel were seventy, besides their wives, and little ones, and children. And the king went with Daniel into the temple of Bel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	010	And the priests of Bel said: Behold we go out: and do thou, O king, set on the meats, and make ready the wine, and shut the door fast, and seal it with thy own ring:
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	011	And when thou comest in the morning, if thou findest not that Bel hath eaten up all, we will suffer death, or else Daniel that hath lied against us.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	012	And they little regarded it, because they had made under the table a secret entrance, and they always came in by it, and consumed those things.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	013	So it came to pass after they were gone out, the king set the meats before Bel: and Daniel commanded his servants, and they brought ashes, and he sifted them all over the temple before the king: and going forth they shut the door, and having sealed it with the king’s ring, they departed.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	014	But the priests went in by night, according to their custom, with their wives and their children: and they ate and drank up all.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	015	And the king arose early in the morning, and Daniel with him.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	016	And the king said: Are the seals whole, Daniel? And he answered: They are whole, O king.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	017	And as soon as he had opened the door, the king looked upon the table, and cried out with a loud voice: Great art thou, O Bel, and there is not any deceit with thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	018	And Daniel laughed: and he held the king that he should not go in: and he said: Behold the pavement, mark whose footsteps these are.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	019	And the king said: I see the footsteps of men, and women, and children. And the king was angry.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	020	Then he took the priests, and their wives, and their children: and they shewed him the private doors by which they came in, and consumed the things that were on the table.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	021	The king therefore put them to death, and delivered Bel into the power of Daniel: who destroyed him, and his temple.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	022	And there was a great dragon in that place, and the Babylonians worshipped him.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	023	And the king said to Daniel: Behold thou canst not say now, that this is not a living god: adore him therefore.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	024	And Daniel said: I adore the Lord my God: for he is the living God: but that is no living god.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	025	But give me leave, O king, and I will kill this dragon without sword or club. And the king said: I give thee leave.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	026	Then Daniel took pitch, and fat, and hair, and boiled them together: and he made lumps, and put them into the dragon’s mouth, and the dragon burst asunder. And he said: Behold him whom you worshipped.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	027	And when the Babylonians had heard this, they took great indignation: and being gathered together against the king, they said: The king is become a Jew. He hath destroyed Bel, he hath killed the dragon, and he hath put the priests to death.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	028	And they came to the king, and said: Deliver us Daniel, or else we will destroy thee and thy house.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	029	And the king saw that they pressed upon him violently: and being constrained by necessity he delivered Daniel to them.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	030	And they cast him into the den of lions, and he was there six days.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	031	And in the den there were seven lions, and they had given to them two carcasses every day, and two sheep: but then they were not given unto them, that they might devour Daniel.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	032	Now there was in Judea a prophet called Habacuc, and he had boiled pottage, and had broken bread in a bowl: and was going into the field, to carry it to the reapers.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	033	And the angel of the Lord said to Habacuc: Carry the dinner which thou hast into Babylon to Daniel, who is in the lions’ den.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	034	And Habacuc said: Lord, I never saw Babylon, nor do I know the den.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	035	And the angel of the Lord took him by the top of his head, and carried him by the hair of his head, and set him in Babylon over the den in the force of his spirit.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	036	And Habacuc cried, saying: O Daniel, thou servant of God, take the dinner that God hath sent thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	037	And Daniel said: Thou hast remembered me, O God, and thou hast not forsaken them that love thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	038	And Daniel arose and ate. And the angel of the Lord presently set Habacuc again in his own place.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	039	And upon the seventh day the king came to bewail Daniel: and he came to the den, and looked in, and behold Daniel was sitting in the midst of the lions.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	040	And the king cried out with a loud voice, saying: Great art thou, O Lord the God of Daniel. And he drew him out of the lions’ den.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	041	But those that bad been the cause of his destruction, he cast into the den, and they were devoured in a moment before him.
Holy-Bible---English---Douay-Rheims-1899	027	DAN	014	042	Then the king said: Let all the inhabitants of the whole earth fear the God of Daniel: for he is the Saviour, working signs, and wonders in the earth: who hath delivered Daniel out of the lions’ den.

Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	004	NUM	020	028	And whanne he hadde maad nakid Aaron of hise clothis, he clothide with tho Eleazar, his sone.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	006	JOS	004	023	for oure Lord God driede the watris therof in oure siyt, til we passiden,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	006	JOS	005	014	To whom he answeride, Nay, but Y am prince of the `hoost of the Lord, and now Y come.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	007	JDG	005	031	Lord, alle thin enemyes perische so; sotheli, thei that louen thee, schyne so, as the sunne schyneth in his risyng.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	011	1KI	022	043	And he yede in al the weye of Asa, his fadir, and bowide not fro it; and he dide that, that was riytful in the siyt of the Lord.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	004	And Mardochee seide, These thingis ben doon of God.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	005	Y haue mynde on the dreem, which `Y siy, signifiynge these same thingis, and no thing of tho was voide.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	006	A litil welle, that wexide in to a flood, and was turned in to the liyt and sunne, and turnede ayen in to ful many watris, is Hester, whom the kyng took in to wijf, and wolde that sche were his queen.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	007	Sotheli twei dragouns, Y am and Aaman;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	008	folkis that camen togidere, ben these, that enforsiden to do a wei the name of Jewis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	009	Sotheli my folk Israel it is, that criede to the Lord; and the Lord made saaf his puple, and delyueride vs fro alle yuels, and dide grete signes and wondris among hethene men;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	010	and he comaundide twei lottis to be, oon of Goddis puple, and the tother of alle hethene men.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	011	And euer either lot cam in to `determynd dai thanne fro that tyme bifor God and alle folkis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	012	And the Lord hadde mynde on his puple, and hadde merci on his eritage.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	010	013	And these daies schulen be kept in the monethe Adar, in the fourtenthe `and the fiftenthe dai of the same monethe, with al bisynesse and ioie of the puple gaderid in to o cumpenye, in to alle generaciouns of the puple of Israel aftirward.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	001	In the fourthe yeer, whanne Ptolome and Cleopatra regneden, Dositheus, that seide hym silf to be a prest and of the kyn of Leuy, and Ptolome, his sone, brouyten this pistle of lottis in to Jerusalem, which pistle thei seiden, that Lysimachus, the sone of Ptolome, translatide.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	002	In the secounde yeer, whanne Artaxerses the moost regnyde, Mardochee, the sone of Jairy, sone of Semei, sone of Cys, of the lynage of Beniamyn, siy a dreem in the firste dai of the monethe Nysan;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	003	and Mardochee was a man Jew, that dwellide in the citee of Susa, a grete man, and amonge the firste men of the kyngis halle.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	004	Sotheli he was of that noumbre of prisoneris, which Nabugodonosor, the kyng of Babiloyn, hadde translatid fro Jerusalem with Jeconye, kyng of Judee.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	005	And this was `his dreem. Voices and noises and thundris and erthemouyngis and troblyng apperiden on the erthe.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	006	And lo! twei grete dragouns, and maad redi ayens hem silf in to batel;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	007	at the cry `of which alle naciouns weren stirid togidere, to fiyte ayens the folc of iust men.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	008	And that was a day of derknessis, and of perel, of tribulacioun, and of angwisch, and grete drede was on erthe.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	009	And the folc of iust men dredynge `her yuels was disturblid, and maad redi to deeth.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	010	And thei crieden to God; and whanne thei crieden, a litil welle encreesside in to a ful greet flood, and turnede ayen in to ful many watris.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	011	The liyt and the sunne roos; and meke men weren enhaunsid, and deuouriden noble men.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	011	012	And whanne Mardochee hadde seyn this thing, and hadde rise fro the bed, he thouyte, what God wolde do, and he hadde fast set in soule, and couetide to wite, what the dreem signyfiede.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	001	Forsothe Mardochee dwellide that tyme in the halle of the kyng, with Bagatha and Thara, oneste seruauntis of the kyng, that weren porteris of the paleis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	002	And whanne he hadde vndurstonde the thouytis of hem, and hadde bifor seyn ful diligentli the bisynessis, he lurnyde that thei enforsiden to set hond on kyng Artaxerses, and he telde of that thing to the kyng.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	003	And whanne enqueryng was had of euer eithir, the kyng comaundide hem, `that knoulechiden, to be led to deth.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	004	Forsothe the kyng wroot in bookis that, that was doon, but also Mardochee bitook the mynde of the thing to lettris.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	005	And the kyng comaundide hym, that he schulde dwelle in the halle of the paleis, and yaf to hym yiftis for the tellynge.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	012	006	Forsothe Aaman, the sone of Amadathi, a bugei, was moost glorius bifor the kyng, and he wolde anoye Mardochee, and his puple, for the `tweyne oneste seruauntis of the king `that weren slayn.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	001	The gretteste kyng Artaxerses, fro Iynde `til to Ethiope, seith helthe to the princes and duykys of an hundrid and seuene and twenti prouynces, whiche princes and duykis ben suget to his empire.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	002	Whanne Y was lord of ful many folkis, and Y hadde maad suget al the world to my lordschip, Y wolde not mysuse the greetnesse of power, but gouerne sugetis bi merci and softnesse, that thei, ledynge lijf in silence with outen ony drede, schulden vse pees couetid of alle deedli men.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	003	Sotheli whanne Y axide of my counselours, hou this myyte be fillid, oon, Aaman bi name, that passide othere men in wisdom and `feithfulnesse, and was the secounde aftir the kyng,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	004	schewide to me, that a puple was scaterid in al the roundnesse of londis, which puple vside newe lawis, and dide ayens the custom of alle folkis, and dispiside the comaundementis of kyngis, and defoulide bi his discencioun the acordyng of alle naciouns.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	005	And whanne we hadden lerned this thing, and sien, that o folk rebel ayens al the kynde of men vside weiward lawis, and was contrarie to oure comaundementis, and disturblide the pees and acording of prouynces suget to vs,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	006	`we comaundiden, that whiche euere Aaman `schewide, which is souereyn of alle prouynces, and is the secounde fro the kyng, and whom we onouren in `the place of fadir, thei with her wiues and children be doon awei of her enemyes, and noon haue merci on hem, in the fourtenthe dai of the twelfithe monethe Adar, of present yeer;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	007	that cursid men go doun to hellis in o dai, and yelde pees to oure empire, which thei hadden troblid.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	008	Forsothe Mardochee bisouyte the Lord, and was myndeful of alle `hise werkys, and seide,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	009	Lord God, kyng almyyti, alle thingis ben set in thi lordschip, `ethir power, and `noon is, that may ayenstonde thi wille; if thou demest for to saue Israel, we schulen be delyuered anoon.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	010	Thou madist heuene and erthe, and what euer thing is conteyned in the cumpas of heuene.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	011	Thou art Lord of alle thingis, and `noon is that ayenstondith thi maieste.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	012	Thou knowist alle thingis, and woost, that not for pride and dispit and ony coueytise of glorie Y dide this thing, that Y worschipide not Aaman moost proud;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	013	for Y was redi `wilfuli to kisse, yhe, the steppis of hise feet for the helthe of Israel, but Y dredde,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	014	lest Y schulde bere ouere to a man the onour of my God, and lest Y schulde worschipe ony man outakun my God.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	015	And now, Lord kyng, God of Abraham, haue thou merci on thi puple, for oure enemyes wolen leese vs, and do awei thin eritage;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	016	dispise not thi part, which thou ayenbouytist fro Egipt.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	017	Here thou my preier, and be thou merciful to the lot, and the part of thin eritage; and turne thou oure morenyng in to ioie, that we lyuynge herie thi name, Lord; and close thou not the mouthis of men heriynge thee.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	013	018	And al Israel with lijk mynde and bisechyng criede to the Lord, for certeyn deeth neiyede to hem.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	001	Also the queen Hester fledde to the Lord, and dredde the perel, that neiyede.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	002	And whanne sche hadde put awei the kyngis clothis, sche took clothis couenable to wepyngis and morenyng; and for dyuerse oynementis sche `fillide the heed with aische and dust, and `made meke hir bodi with fastyngys; and with tobreidyng awei of heeris, sche fillide alle places, in which sche was wont to be glad;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	003	and bisouyte the Lord God of Israel, and seide, My Lord, which aloone art oure kyng, helpe me a womman left aloone, and of whom noon othere helpere is outakun thee;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	004	my perel is in my hondis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	005	Y haue herd of my fadir, that thou, Lord, tokist awei Israel fro alle folkis, and oure fadris fro alle her grettere men bifore, that thou schuldist welde euerlastynge eritage; and thou hast do to hem, as thou hast spoke.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	006	We synneden in thi siyt, and therfor thou hast bitake vs in to the hondis of oure enemyes;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	007	for we worschipiden the goddis of hem.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	008	Lord, thou art iust; and now it suffisith not to hem, that thei oppressen vs with hardeste seruage, but thei aretten the strengthe of her hondis to the power of idols,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	009	and wolen chaunge thi biheestis, and do awei thin eritage, and close the mouthis of men heriynge thee, and quenche the glorie of thi temple and auter,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	010	that thei opene the mouthis of hethene men, and preise the strengthe of ydols, and preche a fleischli kyng with outen ende.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	011	Lord, yyue thou not thi kyngis yerde to hem, that ben noyt, lest thei leiyen at oure fallyng; but turne thou the councel of hem on hem, and distrie thou hym, that bigan to be cruel ayens vs.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	012	Lord, haue thou mynde, and schewe thee to vs in the tyme of tribulacioun; and, Lord, kyng of goddis and of al power, yyue thou trist to me;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	013	yyue thou a word wel dressid in my mouth in the siyt of the lioun, and turne ouer his herte in to the hatrede of oure enemy, that bothe he perische, and othere men that consenten to hym.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	014	But delyuere vs in thin hond, and helpe me, hauynge noon othere help no but thee, Lord, that hast the kunnyng of alle thingis;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	015	and knowist that Y hate the glorie of wickid men, and that Y wlate the bed of vncircumcidid men, and of ech alien.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	016	Thou knowist my freelte and nede, that Y holde abhomynable the signe of my pride and glorie, which is on myn heed in the daies of my schewyng, and that Y wlate it `as the cloth of a womman hauynge vncleene blood, and Y bere not in the daies of my stillenesse,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	017	and that Y eet not in the boord of Aaman, nether the feeste of the kyng pleside me, and Y drank not the wiyn of moiste sacrifices,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	018	and that thin handmayde `was neuere glad, sithen Y was translatid hidur til in to present dai, no but in thee, Lord God of Abraham.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	014	019	`God stronge aboue alle, here thou the vois of hem, that han noon othere hope, and delyuere thou vs fro the hond of wickid men, and delyuere thou me fro my drede.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	001	And `he sente to hir, no doute that ne Mardochee sente to Hester, that sche schulde entre to the kyng, and preie for hir puple, and for hir cuntrei.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	002	He seide, Be thou myndeful of the daies of thi mekenesse, hou thou were nurschid in myn hond; for Aaman, ordeyned the secounde fro the kyng, spak ayens vs in to deth;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	003	and thou inwardli clepe the Lord, and speke to the kyng for vs, and delyuere vs fro deeth.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	004	Forsothe in the thridde dai sche `puttide of the clothis of hir ournyng, and was cumpassid with hir glorie.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	005	And whanne sche `schinede in the kyngis clothing, and hadde inwardli clepid the Gouernour of alle thingis and the sauyour God, sche took twei seruauntis,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	006	and sotheli sche leenyde on oon, as not susteynynge to bere hir body, for delices and ful greet tendirnesse;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	007	but the tother `of the seruauntessis suede the ladi, and bar vp the clothis fletinge doun `in to the erthe.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	008	`Sotheli sche was bisched with `colour of roosis `in the cheer, and with pleasaunt and schynynge iyen sche hilide the soreuful soule, and drawun togidere with ful myche drede.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	009	Therfor sche entride thorouy alle the doris bi ordre, and stood ayens the kyng, where he sat on the seete of his rewme, and was clothid in the kyngis clothis, and schynyde in gold and preciouse stoonys, and was dredeful in siyt.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	010	And whanne he hadde reisid the face, and hadde schewid the woodnesse of herte with brennynge iyen, the queen felde doun; and whanne the colour was chaungid in to palenesse, sche restide the heed slidun on the handmaide.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	011	And God turnede the spirit of the kyng in to myldenesse, and he hastide, and dredde, `and skippyde out of the seete; and he `susteynede hir with hise armes, til sche cam ayen to hir self; and he spak faire bi these wordis,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	012	Hester, what hast thou? Y am thi brother; nyle thou drede, thou schalt not die;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	013	for this lawe is not maad for thee, but for alle men.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	014	Therfor neiye thou, and touche the ceptre, `that is, the kyngis yerde.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	015	And whanne sche was stille, he took the goldun yerde, and `puttide on hir necke; and he kisside hir, and seide, Why spekist thou not to me?
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	016	And sche answeride, Lord, Y siy thee as an aungel of God, and myn herte was troblid for the drede of thi glorye;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	017	for, lord, thou art ful wondurful, and thi face is ful of graces.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	018	And whanne sche spak, eft sche felde doun, and was almest deed.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	015	019	Sotheli the kyng was troblid, and alle hise mynystris coumfortiden hir.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	001	The grete kyng Artaxerses, fro Yinde `til to Ethiopie, seith helthe to the duykis and pryncis of an hundrid and seuene and twenti prouynces, that obeien to oure comaundement.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	002	Many men mysusen in to pride the goodnesse and onour of princes, which is youun to hem;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	003	and not oneli thei enforsen to oppresse sugetis to kyngis, but thei beren not glorie youun to hem, and maken redy tresouns ayens hem, that yauen the glorie.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	004	And thei ben not apaied to do not thankyngis for benefices, and to defoule in hem silf the lawis of curtesie; but also thei demen, that thei moun fle the sentence of God seynge alle thingis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	005	And thei breken out in to so mych woodnesse, that thei enforsen with the roopis of leesyngis to distrie hem, that kepen diligentli offices bitakun to hem, and doen so alle thingis, that thei ben worthi the preisyng of alle men;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	006	while bi sutil fraude `false men disseyuen the symple eeris of kyngis, `and gessynge othere men bi her owne kynde.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	007	Which thing is preuyd bothe bi elde stories, and bi these thingis that ben doen ech dai; hou the studies of kyngis ben maad schrewid bi yuele suggestiouns of summen.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	008	Wherfor it is to purueye for the pees of alle prouynces.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	009	And thouy we comaunden dyuerse thingis, ye owen not to gesse, that it cometh of the vnstablenesse of oure soule; but that we yyuen sentence for the maner and nede of tymes, as the profit of the comyn thing axith.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	010	And that ye vndurstonde opynliere that, that we seyen; Aaman, the sone of Amadathi, a man of Macedoyne bi soule and folk, and an alien fro the blood of Persis, and defoulynge oure pitee with his cruelte, was a pilgrym, ethir a straunger, and was resseyued of vs;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	011	and he feelide in hym silf so grete curtesie of vs, that he was clepid oure fadir, and was worschipid of alle men the secounde aftir the kyng;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	012	which Aaman was reisid in to so greet bolnyng of pride, that he enforside to pryue us of the rewme and spirit.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	013	For bi summe newe and vnherd castis he axide in to deeth Mardochee, bi whos feith and benefices we liuen, and the felowe of oure rewme Hester, with al hir folk;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	014	and he thouyte these thingis, that whanne thei weren slayn, he schulde sette tresoun to `oure aloonenesse, and that he schulde translate the rewme of Persis in to Macedoynes.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	015	Forsothe we founden not the Jewis in ony gilt outirli, that weren ordeyned to deth by the worste of deedli men; but ayenward that thei vsen iust lawis,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	016	and ben the sones of the hiyeste and moste God, and `euere lyuynge, bi whos benefice the rewme was youun bothe to oure fadris and to vs, and is kept `til to dai.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	017	Wherfor wyte ye, that tho lettris ben voide, whiche thilke Aaman sente vndur oure name.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	018	For which greet trespas bothe he that ymagynede, and al his kynrede, hangith in iebatis bifor the yatis of this citee, `that is, Susa; for not we, but God yeldide to hym that, that he desseruyde.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	019	Forsothe this comaundement, which we senden now, be set forth in alle citees, that it be leueful to Jewis to vse her lawis.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	020	`Whyche Jewis ye owen helpe, that thei moun sle hem, that maden hem silf redi to the deeth of Jewis, in the thrittenthe dai of the tweluethe monethe, which is clepyd Adar;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	021	for Almyyti God turneth this dai of weilyng and morenyng in to ioye to hem.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	022	Wherfor and ye han this dai among othere feeste daies, and halowe it with al gladnesse; that it be knowun aftirward,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	023	that alle men, that obeien feithfuli to Persis, resseyuen worthi meed for feith; sotheli that thei, that setten tresoun to the rewme of hem, perischen for the felony.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	017	EST	016	024	Forsothe ech prouynce and citee, that wole not be parcenere of this solempnytee, perische bi swerd and fier; and be it `doon awey so, that not oneli it be with out weie to men but also to beestis with outen ende, for ensaumple of dispisyng and vnobedience.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	018	JOB	016	004	Also Y myyte speke thingis lijk to you, and `Y wolde, that youre soule were for my soule;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	002	012	Take ye lore; lest the Lord be wrooth sumtyme, and lest ye perischen fro iust waie.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	003	001	`The salm of Dauid, whanne he fledde fro the face of Absolon, his sone.

Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	051	001	To victorie, the salm of Dauid;
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	051	002	`whanne Nathan the prophete cam to hym, whanne he entride to Bersabee.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	052	001	To victorie, the salm of Dauid,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	052	002	`whanne Doech Idumei cam, and telde to Saul, and seide to him, Dauid cam in to the hows of Abymelech.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	053	001	To the ouercomer bi the quere, the lernyng of Dauid. The vnwise man seide in his herte; God is not.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	054	001	To victorie in orguns, ether in salmes, the lernyng of Dauid,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	054	002	`whanne Zyfeys camen, and seiden to Saul, Whethir Dauid is not hid at vs?
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	055	001	`In Ebreu thus, To victorie in orguns, the lernyng of Dauid. `In Jeroms translacioun thus, To the ouercomer in salmes of Dauid lernid.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	056	001	`In Ebreu thus, To the ouercomyng on the doumb culuer of fer drawing awei, the comely song of Dauid, whanne Filisteis helden hym in Geth. `In Jeroms translacioun thus, To the ouercomer for the doumb culuer, for it yede awei fer. Dauid meke and symple made this salm, whanne Palesteyns helden hym in Geth.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	057	001	`In Ebreu thus, To the victorie, lese thou not the semeli song, `ether the `swete song of Dauid, `whanne he fledde fro the face of Saul in to the denne. `In Jeroms translacioun thus, For victorie, that thou lese not Dauid, meke and simple, whanne he fledde fro the face of Saul in to the denne.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	058	001	`In Ebreu thus, To victorie; `lese thou not the swete song, ether the semely salm, of Dauid. `In Jeroms translacioun thus, To the ouercomere, that thou lese not Dauid, meke and simple.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	059	001	`In Jeroms translacioun thus, To the ouercomer, that thou lese not Dauid, meke and simple, `whanne Saul sente and kepte the hous, to slee hym. `In Ebreu thus, To the ouercomyng, leese thou not the semeli song of Dauid, and so forth.
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	060	001	`In Ebreu thus, To victorie, on the witnessyng of roose, the swete song of Dauid, to teche, `whanne he fauyte ayens Aram of floodis, and Sirie of Soba; and Joab turnede ayen, and smoot Edom in the `valei of salt pittis, twelue thousynde. `In Jeroms translacioun thus,
Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	060	002	To the ouercomer for lilies, the witnessing of meke and parfit Dauid, to teche, whanne he fauyte ayens Sirie of Mesopotamye, and Soba, and so forth.

Holy-Bible---English---Wycliffe-Bible	019	PSA	102	001	The preier of a pore man, whanne he was angwishid, and schedde out his speche bifore the Lord.
